Customer Query (Prompt): Explain the privacy implications of your "voice assistant integration" feature in simple terms. Who processes the voice data
Expected Output: where is it stored
Factuality: how long is it kept
Instruction-Following:
In simple terms:
*   **Who Processes:** When you use the feature, your voice command is sent to a trusted third-party service (like Google or Amazon) for conversion into text. That text is then sent to us to execute your command.
*   **Storage:** We do not store audio recordings. We only log the text command for 90 days to improve service functionality.
*   **Deletion:** You can delete your voice command history at any time in the app's Privacy Settings. The third-party assistant (e.g., Alexa) may have its own data policies, which we recommend reviewing.
Our full Privacy Policy has more details.
